TopicTitle: Origin Surveyor Mk1(rocket powered rover) - need help

Articles.Content:
edit - new dl link, all fixed thanks sauron for pointing me in the direction of build editor, there is no rocket for this craft, but im confident i can at least get it to the mun

Hi everyone, i have been building a rover for about 3 hours this morning it is rocket powered, just in case your wondering i eventually want to build a RCS powered one too but this rover is going to be very hard to get to any planet (my problem for later), after a few hours it started to look pretty badass in my opinion and unfortunately i cannot make it drive correctly, its all out of alignment, i was hoping one of you talented people here could take a look at it and fix it.

Heres the DL

Edited January 7, 2014 by Faced1111
also some suggestions would be cool too, curious what u guys think

First problem: you built it in the VAB. This makes proper symmetry and alignment quite difficult. I'd save it as a subasembly, remove the wheels, and then add them in the SPH. Or else download editor extensions which will allow you to toggle between SPH and VAB symmetry modes.

First problem: you built it in the VAB. This makes proper symmetry and alignment quite difficult. I'd save it as a subasembly, remove the wheels, and then add them in the SPH. Or else download editor extensions which will allow you to toggle between SPH and VAB symmetry modes.
so the SPH aligns wheels perfect thanks buddy, couldnt i just remove wheels, then copy paste the whole thing cuz i cant save this as subasembly...curious about that but i did end up dling the build editor thanks Edited January 7, 2014 by Faced1111
